title: Queens Mall Evacuated After Suspicious Vehicle Reported
sub_head: NYPD investigators say items found in vehicle constituted a hoax bomb
body:
A Queens mall was evacuated Monday morning after a vehicle containing a fake bomb was reported in a parking garage there, New York Police Department officials said.
The officials said the NYPD Bomb Squad and Emergency Service Unit officers were dispatched shortly after 7:40 a.m. to Queens Place Mall in the Elmhurst section of the borough after a 911 caller reported a Tesla vehicle that apparently contained propane tanks connected to a battery.
A preliminary investigation determined the tanks didnâ€™t constitute a threat, the officials said. However, investigators determined the items found in the vehicle constituted a hoax bomb intended to cause a disruption, according to police officials.
A spokeswoman for Queens Place Mall said the mall remained closed Monday while police and the New York Fire Department continued their investigation.
The investigation led to the closure of nearby roads for roughly two hours. The evacuation orders and road closures began to be lifted around 10 a.m., police officials said.
